definition[0]: the profit or the amount of money that a business makes or loses
definition[1]: the least amount of money that you are willing to accept in a business deal
definition[2]: the figure showing a company’s total profit or loss
example[0]: The company’s bottom line showed a net profit of 173 million euros.
example[1]: Cost-cutting moves under way at the banks should help bottom lines.
definition[3]: the end result of something or the most important point about something
example[2]: Accounting doesn’t change how much money you bring in; the bottom line is that their movies didn’t do well.
